results.title: HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitor, Simvastatin Is Effective in Decreasing Degree of Myocarditis by Inhibiting Metalloproteinases Activation
results.text_hl: 10 @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ with induced @<m>DISEASE_Myocarditis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009205 @@@EAM@@@ were divided into two groups (n = 5): high-dosage @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ group (30 mg/kg per day; @<m>DISEASE_Myocarditis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009205 @@@EAM@@@+S30) and low-dosage @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ group (3 mg/kg per day: @<m>DISEASE_Myocarditis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009205 @@@EAM@@@+S3).

citations.NLM: Skrzypiec-Spring M, Sapa-Wojciechowska A, Haczkiewicz-Leśniak K, Piasecki T, Kwiatkowska J, Podhorska-Okołów M, Szeląg A. HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitor, Simvastatin Is Effective in Decreasing Degree of Myocarditis by Inhibiting Metalloproteinases Activation Biomolecules. 2021 Sep 28;11(10):. PMID: 34680049
citations.BibTeX: @article{34680049, title={HMG-CoA Reductase Inhibitor, Simvastatin Is Effective in Decreasing Degree of Myocarditis by Inhibiting Metalloproteinases Activation}, author={Skrzypiec-Spring M and Sapa-Wojciechowska A and Haczkiewicz-Leśniak K and Piasecki T and Kwiatkowska J and Podhorska-Okołów M and Szeląg A}, journal={Biomolecules}, volume={11}, number={10}}

results.title: A High-Fat Diet Exacerbates the Course of Experimental Trypanosoma cruzi Infection That Can Be Mitigated by Treatment with Simvastatin
results.text_hl: Therefore, the aim of this study was to evaluate @<m>DISEASE_Myocarditis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009205 @@@myocarditis@@@ in @SPECIES_5693 @@@T. cruzi@@@-@DISEASE_Infections @DISEASE_MESH:D007239 @@@infected@@@ @CELLLINE_CVCL:C0MU @@@C57BL/6@@@ @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@:acute phase:fed a high-fat diet and treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, a @CHEMICAL_Lipids @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008055 @@@lipid@@@-lowering medication.

citations.NLM: de Souza DMS, de Paula Costa G, Leite ALJ, de Oliveira DS, de Castro Pinto KM, Farias SEB, Simões NF, de Paiva NCN, de Abreu Vieira PM, da Silva CAM, Figueiredo VP, de Jesus Menezes AP, Talvani A. results.title: Amelioration of myocarditis by statin through inhibiting cross-talk between antigen presenting cells and lymphocytes in rats.
results.text_hl: To investigate the effect of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@, a lipophilic statin, on @<m>DISEASE_Myocarditis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009205 @@@myocarditis@@@, we explored whether @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ is able to inhibit experimental @<m>DISEASE_Myocarditis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009205 @@@autoimmune myocarditis@@@ (@<m>DISEASE_Myocarditis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009205 @@@EAM@@@) and adoptive transfer of @<m>DISEASE_Myocarditis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D009205 @@@EAM@@@ in @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@.

citations.NLM: Wu JL, Matsui S, Zong ZP, Nishikawa K, Sun BG, Katsuda S, Fu M. Amelioration of myocarditis by statin through inhibiting cross-talk between antigen presenting cells and lymphocytes in rats. J Mol Cell Cardiol. 2008 Jun;44(6):1023-31. PMID: 18471827
